content.title: In Situ Reconstruction for Graft Infection
content.description: Reconstruction in the native anatomic location for infected grafts

key_concepts.details: Autologous femoral vein (NAIS), cryopreserved allograft, rifampin-soaked Dacron
Neoaortoiliac system using femoral-popliteal veins for aortic replacement
Pedicled omental coverage provides vascularized tissue and antimicrobial properties
Lower reinfection rates than prosthetic replacement; lower amputation than extra-anatomic

content.clinical_significance: Preferred approach for virulent organisms or AEF when possible
